case_vignette: A 70-YEAR-OLD WHITE MAN PRESENTS FOR EVALUATION OF A RECENT FOOT INJURY. THE PATIENT STATES THAT HE HIT HIS FOOT AT HOME AND NOTICED BLOOD ON THE FLOOR; BECAUSE OF A PREVIOUS INJURY, HE WAS UNABLE TO VIEW HIS SOLE. A LARGE (SEVERAL CM), IRREGULARLY SHAPED PLAQUE IS SEEN ON THE MID-ANTERIOR VOLAR FOOT. THE LESION IS BROWN AND BLACK, WITH CENTRAL RED DISCOLORATION AND OVERLYING YELLOW-WHITE SCALE.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I hit my foot at home recently and noticed some blood on the floor.
Did the injury lead to any changes on the skin like open wounds, bruising, or swelling?
Yes, there's a large, irregularly shaped area on my foot that is brown and black with a central red discoloration and a yellow-white scale on top.
Have you noticed any fluid or pus coming from the area? Also, is there any odor?
No, there's no fluid or pus coming from the area, and there's no odor.
How long ago did you notice these changes after the injury?
I noticed the blood on the floor immediately after I hit my foot.
Do you have any pre-existing conditions like diabetes or peripheral vascular disease, or any other medical conditions that affect your circulation or immune system?
I cannot specify any pre-existing conditions as no specific medical history details were given in my description.
Have you experienced any other symptoms like fever, or increased pain and sensitivity in the affected area?
No, I haven't experienced any fever or increased pain and sensitivity in the affected area.
Is there any history of similar skin changes in your family?
I haven't mentioned any family history related to similar skin changes.
Final Diagnosis: Necrotic ulcer

The patient has not specified any pre-existing conditions, as no specific medical history details were offered.
